intro: Anthemis cretica subsp. leucanthemoides, commonly known as the white anthemis, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in flat, disc-like clusters. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. Its foliage is aromatic and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
